text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies, today I have a
Ro: special guest, Felicia Day! Felicia: Hi!

Ro: She’s a super cool actress, writer,
producer, and she has her own

Ro: YouTube channel, Geek and Sundry. I’ll
put the links down below

Ro: so that you can go check out her channel
and her Twitter.

Felicia: Oh thank you very much! Ro: And all
your social medias!

Felicia: I try to be amusing. Ro: Yeah, she’s
pretty funny and I kind of

Ro: love her! Felicia: Aw! Ro: So, today,
we are gonna be making something

Ro: that I thought would be a perfect fit.
We’re gonna be making

Ro: D20 Dice Cookies! Felicia: I am very excited
about this, because I

Felicia: love dice, I have a huge collection.
Ro: Because I heard that you’re

Ro: kind of into tabletop games and stuff.
Felicia: I am into the tabletop

Felicia: games, I played D&D a lot, and I also
play a lot of online role playing

Felicia: games. I love, I love dice, I basically have
about 1,000 dice… At home.

Ro: I have 2, so… Felicia: Oh… Well that’s
the same!

Ro: Um, we all start somewhere! Felicia: Yeah,
it’s true, you, you’re…

Felicia: You know, next time I come to visit,
I’ll bring you a couple.

Ro: Oh my gosh yes! Felicia: And every time
you’ll accumulate a different

Felicia: color. It’s really more about the
way the dice look.

Ro: They’re pretty lonely right now, look,
just 2 of ‘em!

Felicia: I know, but this is good for a fire
mage or something don’t you think?

Ro: Yeah! It’s perfect, it’s like Mother
of Dragons looking!

Felicia: Oh my gosh I love that show! Ro:
OK, let’s see who wins,
Ro: ready, set, go!

Felicia: Ew, a 2 and an 8, that wasn’t good
on either of our parts!
Ro: OK, that was pretty bad… Felicia: Yeah…
Ro: OK, let’s go on to what we’ll need!

Ro: Eggs, flour, butter, sugar, just regular
white sugar.

Felicia: Vanilla, baking powder, salt, and
a hexagon shaped cookie cutter.

Felicia: This 6 sides. Ro: Yeah, 6! Felicia:
1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6! Not an octagon!

Ro: Not an octagon! Not a stop sign, I thought
it was a stop sign.

Felicia: I wasn’t gonna, I wasn’t gonna
out you like that!
Ro: I’ll out myself!

Ro: Now, first we’re going to beat together
our sugar and butter,

Ro: until it’s nice and smooth and fluffy!
It’s called creaming! Felicia: Oh!

Ro: So we’re gonna add the sugar first.
Felicia: OK! We’re going to crrrr…

Ro: Crrr-ream! Felicia: Crrrr-ream it! Ro:
Crrr-ream this!

Ro: And then we’re gonna add 3 sticks of
butter which is a cup and a 1/2.

Ro: because each of these are a 1/2 cup. Felicia:
This is already a good

Felicia: recipe! With this much butter, it
can’t go wrong!

Felicia: OK, come on butter! Ro: Come on out
of there!

Felicia: Alright, come on little butter! Ro:
Come on butter!

Felicia: Come on butter! Ro: You can do it,
come on! Felicia: Yes!

Ro: Yes! Felicia: Victory! And then we’re
done!

Ro: Now it’s time to cream! Felicia: Oh
we’re not done? Ro: Get creamy!

Ro: Are you ready? OK! Felicia: AH! I don’t
like this part!

Ro: Boom! All creamy, this is what you want
it to look like!

Ro: Now we are going to beat together our
eggs and vanilla extract,
Ro: in a separate little bowl!

Ro: We’re gonna do a tablespoon of vanilla…
No a teaspoon, just kidding!

Felicia: You could do a tablespoon! But it
would probably be very vanilla-y.

Ro: Super vanilla-y! Felicia: How many teaspoons
are in a tablespoon?

Ro: 4? Felicia: I would say… I would bet
3.

Felicia: How about whoever rolls the higher
dice is right.
Felicia: OK, let’s see!
Ro: Come on 4!
Felicia: 10, and a 9 I won! It’s a 3!

Ro: OK, now we’re gonna crack these eggs…
Gosh these are messy!
Felicia: I know, I don’t like cracking eggs.

Ro: Yeah, are you gonna do the 1 handed crack?
Felicia: No! Do I look skilled?

Ro: Yeah, you can do this! OK, you ready?
Here, here’s the bowl…

Felicia: This is a disaster waiting! Ro: You
can either do it on the table

Ro: or the bowl edge, and you just go crack,
and then you twist it over

Ro: this little thing. Felicia: TWIST? Ro:
Yeah.

Felicia: I’m gonna get shell everywhere
Ro! Ro: Crack, twist!

Ro: It’s a little messy, but it works and
it looks pretty cool!

Ro: Crack, twist! Felicia: Ahhh! Ro: Yes,
yes, yes, twist!

Felicia: Get out of there! Ro: Twist it real
good! Nah-nah-nah-nah-nah-nah!

Felicia: Well, thank you backup dancer, but
that was not well done!
Ro: Nah-nah-nah!

Ro: OK, we’re just mixing the eggs and the
vanilla together here, it’s

Ro: nice and smooth, and we’re going to
add it into the big bowl of the

Ro: butter and the sugar. Felicia: Yay! Ro:
Alright, let’s pour this in.

Felicia: OK, do I need to do this thing again?
Ro: Oh yeah, you, you wanna?

Felicia: I don’t… Ro: OK, you do this
I’ll gradually pour this in.
Felicia: I don’t like this…
Ro: There we go, there we go!
Felicia: Oh now it looks like something!
Felicia: Should I whip this more?
Felicia: Ah!
Felicia: It’s so loud!

Felicia: I feel like you can see the sunset
in there!

Ro: Once you’ve mixed in all of your eggs,
it’s nice and fluffy, we’re gonna

Ro: mix our dry ingredients. Here is 5 cups
of flour, in this bowl, and we’re gonna

Ro: add 1 teaspoon of salt. Felicia: Mmmhmmm.
Ro: And we’re gonna use 2

Ro: teaspoons of baking powder. Then you mix
in your dice! Felicia: No!
Ro: There’ll be special surprises!

Ro: OK, are you ready to get that mixer going?
Felicia: Oh again?

Ro: Ready, set… Felicia: Ahhhh! Ro:
Gradually mix!

Ro: Oh gosh! Oh pfft! Felicia: OH! What am
I doing wrong?
Ro: OK, whew!

Ro: Ta-da! We’ve got everything mixed…
Felicia: Ta-dough! Ro: Ta-dough!

Ro: I love having you be here because you’re
like, super smart and you’re like a
Ro: writer and you come up with these zingers!
Felicia: You can take that forever!

Ro: Now what you’re gonna do once you have
your dough ready is…
Felicia: Is this a… Ro: Get some saran wrap. Felicia: There's a little thing. Ro: I got him, I got him.

Ro: Just get a big, long, yeah. Felicia: There,
OK, yeah. Ro: Perfect!

Ro: And now you’re just gonna take the dough,
it’s really sticky,

Ro: and you’re just gonna scoop it right
in the middle.

Ro: Now you’re gonna put these in the fridge
for about an hour, or you can do it

Ro: overnight, whatever you’d like, but
an hour is the minimum!
Ro: And then we’ll roll it out.

Ro: We just took the dough out of the fridge,
it’s all nice and chilled.

Ro: And it’s very moldable, easy to work
with.

Felicia: And it doesn’t look disgusting
anymore! Ro: No!

Ro: Gave you a little happy face! Felicia:
Aw, that’s scary!

Ro: OK, well now you’re just gonna take
a little bit of flour, sprinkle it

Ro: on the table, put this little blob down,
sprinkle a little on top.

Ro: And then I’ll take a rolling pin, roll
out the dough.

Felicia: I don’t need a rolling pin. Ro:
Oh girl, OK! Felicia: No I do!

Felicia: OK here we go! Oh no! Too much! Ro:
No, no that’s great.

Felicia: Too much, it’s spreading. Ro: Yeah,
yeah get it to move!

Ro: Now you’re gonna take your fancy cookie
cutters, and just cut out the
Ro: shapes and then put them on the pan.

Ro: Let no dough be wasted! Felicia: Why were
you an orphan?

Felicia: You were like, oh my gosh, can I
have some dough please?

Ro: Now you’re gonna take your spatula,
and just pick ‘em up like a little

Ro: pancake, and then put them on the cookie
dough sheet.

Ro: Once you got all your cookies cut out
you’re gonna heat your oven to

Ro: 350 and bake them for 6-8 minutes. Just keep
your eye on ‘em, you don’t
Ro: want them to burn!

Ro: Once your cookies are all done baking and
they’ve had plenty of time to cool,

Ro: make sure that they’ve cooled before
you decorate, you’re gonna use

Ro: frosting! We have red and white cookie
frosting, and the first thing

Ro: That you’re gonna do is frost them red.
And you’re gonna follow the

Ro: shape but leave a little bit of space
on the edge all the way around.

Ro: Once you got your cookies frosted red,
we’re gonna take the white frosting

Ro: and you’re just gonna make an outline
all the way around the red.

Ro: Oh that looks really good! Oh my gosh,
look at you! Felicia: Look at me!
Ro: You have so much control!

Ro: Now that we have a white outline all the
way around, we are going to now

Ro: make the little triangle designs, making
these look like actual dice.

Felicia: Oh gosh! OK, that toothpick is magic,
it’s like your Harry Potter
Felicia: Wand! That toothpick.

Ro: Come to here, come to here! Felicia: OK,
where do I go now?

Ro: OK, you ready? Once you hit there, go
here. Felicia: Go north, go north!

Ro: I feel like those flaggers at the airport.
Felicia: Where am I going?

Felicia: Where am I going? Ro: Go back, go
back this way. Felicia: OK, ahhhh!
Ro: That’s perfect, oh my gosh! Both: Boom!
Ro: Perfect landing, nice job pilot!

Felicia: That looks like a real dice! That
looks awesome!
Ro: Yeah, these are so cute!
Ro: Ta-dough! See I used it!

Ro: Our cookies are all done! we’ve got
our D20 Dice Cookies, they’re pretty

Ro: awesome! Alright, I will put all of Felicia’s
links again down below,

Ro: so go check them out! She’s super cool
and super awesome and has

Ro: so many cool shows on her YouTube channel!
Yeah, thanks for coming!

Felicia: Thank you! Yeah, I had such a good
time!

Ro: If you guys have any other suggestions for
any other Nerdy Nummies,

Ro: please let me know, leave me a comment
down below and I will do my
Ro: best to make it happen!
Ro: OK, bye-bye you guys!
Ro: Let me give you a nightmare!
Felicia: No, no! You already gave me a nightmare!

Ro: Let me give you a huge nightmare! Felicia:
Ro, I can’t!

Ro: Are you ready? Felicia: I’m still…
I have to stay on camera!
Ro: Wha-wha-wha-wha-wha!
Felicia: That’s so…

Felicia: If that becomes an animated GIF it’s
gonna haunt my dreams!
